subject: Decisions and Verdicts
Sex Crimes
lead_paragraph: Rape charges, and all others, were dropped against the former Penn State running back Austin Scott. The decision came after Pennsylvania’s Superior Court ruled earlier in the day that jurors could hear testimony about the accuser’s involvement in a separate sexual assault case in 2003. The defendant in that case was acquitted. The Centre County district attorney’s office said it withdrew the charges because there was “no reasonable likelihood” it could meet the burden of proof. Scott, 23, was suspended Oct. 5 by Coach Joe Paterno and missed the rest of his senior season.
